result.markdown:
--- title: "Hello World: Your First Quarto Post" description: "A template post demonstrating Quarto's computational document features" date: "2025-01-19" categories: [tutorial, python] --- This is an example post to demonstrate Quarto blogging. Delete this post once you've created your own. ## Quarto Basics You can write regular markdown, include math like $E = mc^2$, and embed code with syntax highlighting. ## Code Blocks Use triple backticks with a language name for syntax-highlighted code: ::: {#99cef593 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import pandas as pd import numpy as np # Create sample data data = { 'Category': ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D'], 'Values': np.random.randint(10, 100, 4) } df = pd.DataFrame(data) df ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=1} ```{=html}
Category Values
0 A 53
1 B 46
2 C 69
3 D 21
``` ::: ::: ## Executable Code To make code actually **execute** and show outputs (plots, tables, etc.), add curly braces around the language name: `` ```{python} `` instead of `` ```python ``. This requires Jupyter. Install with: `pip install jupyter` ## Tips - **Jupyter notebooks**: Drop `.ipynb` files directly into `posts/` - they render automatically - **Freeze outputs**: The `freeze: true` setting in `_metadata.yml` caches outputs so code doesn't re-run on every build - **Categories**: Use the `categories` field for filtering on the blog listing page - **Drafts**: Set `draft: true` to hide posts from the listing (remove when ready to publish)
